docs.lead_paragraph: The Blue Dogs have been hogging the health care spotlight for the last week. Now they're having to share with it with the Senate Finance Committee chairman, Max Baucus, and the rest of his small troupe.
docs.abstract: Is the Senate Finance Committee fit to draft the health care reform bill?

docs.lead_paragraph: Some readers ask why I don't talk about HR 676, which would establish a single-payer system for health care -- similar to Medicare, the single-payer system older Americans already have and love, although they don't think it's a government program.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the debate over health care rages in Washington, an adviser to President Obama recently used Goldman Sachs as an example of a firm with the kind of "gold-plated Cadillac" plans for top executives that some lawmakers want to tax.

headline.main: Gilded Health Plans on Wall St.? Not Necessarily

headline.main: Small-Business Health Care Reform, in Theory and in Practice

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama continues to pitch health care reform to the country on Tuesday, answering questions both live and over the telephone from A.A.R.P. members at the group's headquarters. Watch for a discussion about Medicare and whether there will be worries expressed that benefits would be cut, rather than expanded.

headline.main: The Early Word: More Town Hall Sessions on Health Care
